title: These Licensed Games Are Perfect For Youngsters
description: If you’re looking for a fun way to bring your kid’s favorite TV shows and movies to life, consider adding a licensed video game to your collection. These give you (and your kids) a chance to jump into the shoes of their favorite characters, including SpongeBob, Bluey, Paw Patrol, and many more. These games tend to be easy enough for newer and younger players, though some offer enough challenges to keep older gamers engaged too.Best Buy has dozens of these family-friendly games up for grabs, spanning PS5, Xbox, and Switch. Here's a look at a few that are available now. Baby Shark: Sing & Swim Party$20Baby Shark: Sing & Swim Party is an adorable music game that lets you explore Tropical Bay and Ocean City with the iconic family of fish. You’ll choose from five customizable characters as you dodge obstacles to the beat of the song and try to earn as many points as possible. It’s essentially a rhythm game for kids, and it even supports local four-player coop if the whole family wants to join in. See at Best Buy Bluey: The Video Game$20 - $40Along with a chance to play as Bluey in either a Story or Free Play mode, Bluey: The Video Game lets you roam around as Chilli, Bingo, or Bandit. You’ll unravel a brand new story as you trek through the Heeler House, Playgrounds, and other popular spots from the hit TV show. There’s also a cooperative mode so you can play with a friend, as well as a variety of challenges to keep things interesting.See at Best BuyPS4 -- $40PS5 -- $20 ($40)Xbox -- $35 ($40)Switch -- $40 Disney Dreamlight Valley: Cozy Edition$35 - $40Part adventure game, part life sim, Disney Dreamlight Valley plays out a bit like Animal Crossing. But instead of meeting furry animal-like creatures, you’ll encounter familiar faces from the Disney universe. You’ll be tasked with helping remove the Night Thorns from the land to restore it to its former glory, while also building your very own neighborhood and befriending its inhabitants. It’s a relaxing game with plenty to explore, making it a wonderful fit for all Disney fans. The Cozy Edition includes bonuses like an exclusive double-sided poster, digital cosmetics, and in-game currency.See at Best BuyPS5 -- $35 ($40)PS4 -- $40Switch -- $40 Disney Epic Mickey Rebrushed$42 - $60The original Epic Mickey released in 2010--and whether you missed out on the adventure or are a longtime fan, this remake is the best way to play in 2025. Featuring updated graphics, improved controls, and new movement skills (like dashing and ground pound), the 3D platformer is better than ever. You’ll get the chance to complete missions based on the show as you explore Jake’s Mountain, Barkingburg, and other familiar spots. You can also customize your character and vehicles with a variety of unlockable cosmetics. Cooperative play supports up to two players. Characters have unique skills to help you on your journey (such as super speed and creating snowballs), which should keep things interesting as you fend off the bad guys and locate all your missing gear. You and up to one other player will work through six different levels inspired by the Pickles’ residence, playing as Tommy, Chuckie, Phil, and Lil. The cooperative 3D platformer lets you see three new regions in the Smurf universe and enjoy deeper combat thanks to the latest innovation in Smurf technology--the SmurfoMix.See at Best BuyPS5 -- $31 ($40)PS4 -- $40Xbox -- $40Switch -- $35 ($40) The Smurfs Village Party$40The Smurfs Village Party is essentially two games in one. The first mode is Adventure, which tasks you with exploring 10 regions and meeting over 100 Smurfs as you complete a variety of quests. The second mode is Party Game, which supports up to four local players and has you battling it out in 50 mini-games. These fall into six different categories (sport, luck, memory, battle, accuracy, and quickness), so only the most versatile Smurf will emerge victorious. Give it a look if you’re seeking a fun game the whole family can enjoy.See at Best BuyPS5 -- $40Switch -- $33 ($40)

html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

If you’re looking for a fun way to bring your kid’s favorite TV shows and movies to life, consider adding a licensed video game to your collection. These give you (and your kids) a chance to jump into the shoes of their favorite characters, including SpongeBob, Bluey, Paw Patrol, and many more. These games tend to be easy enough for newer and younger players, though some offer enough challenges to keep older gamers engaged too.

Best Buy has dozens of these family-friendly games up for grabs, spanning PS5, Xbox, and Switch. Here's a look at a few that are available now.

Baby Shark: Sing & Swim Party

$20

Baby Shark: Sing & Swim Party is an adorable music game that lets you explore Tropical Bay and Ocean City with the iconic family of fish. You’ll choose from five customizable characters as you dodge obstacles to the beat of the song and try to earn as many points as possible. It’s essentially a rhythm game for kids, and it even supports local four-player coop if the whole family wants to join in.

Bluey: The Video Game

$20 - $40

Along with a chance to play as Bluey in either a Story or Free Play mode, Bluey: The Video Game lets you roam around as Chilli, Bingo, or Bandit. You’ll unravel a brand new story as you trek through the Heeler House, Playgrounds, and other popular spots from the hit TV show. There’s also a cooperative mode so you can play with a friend, as well as a variety of challenges to keep things interesting.

See at Best Buy

  • PS4 -- $40
  • PS5 -- $20 ($40)
  • Xbox -- $35 ($40)
  • Switch -- $40

Disney Dreamlight Valley: Cozy Edition

$35 - $40

Part adventure game, part life sim, Disney Dreamlight Valley plays out a bit like Animal Crossing. But instead of meeting furry animal-like creatures, you’ll encounter familiar faces from the Disney universe. You’ll be tasked with helping remove the Night Thorns from the land to restore it to its former glory, while also building your very own neighborhood and befriending its inhabitants. It’s a relaxing game with plenty to explore, making it a wonderful fit for all Disney fans. The Cozy Edition includes bonuses like an exclusive double-sided poster, digital cosmetics, and in-game currency.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $35 ($40)
  • PS4 -- $40
  • Switch -- $40

Disney Epic Mickey Rebrushed

$42 - $60

The original Epic Mickey released in 2010--and whether you missed out on the adventure or are a longtime fan, this remake is the best way to play in 2025. Featuring updated graphics, improved controls, and new movement skills (like dashing and ground pound), the 3D platformer is better than ever. You’ll be tasked with venturing through the Wastelands (a region filled with forgotten Disney characters) as you attempt to clear it from the mysterious Blot.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $42 ($60)
  • Xbox -- $48 ($60)
  • Switch -- $60

Dog Man: Mission Impawsible

$40

If you’re a fan of the Dog Man books, check out this quirky 2D platformer. You’ll play as Dog Man and his Supa Buddies as you track down the key to the city--which has suddenly fallen into the hands of the bad guys. Each character has its own ability (such as Rocket Boots and Retractable Claws), giving you plenty of ways to overcome all the obstacles standing between you and your goals.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5
  • Switch

Nick Jr. Party Adventure

$20

Join Dora, Blue, Blaze, and other iconic Nick Jr. characters in this family-friendly puzzle platformer. Before the party can start, you and up to one other player will need to locate all the missing party supplies. There are 25 different characters to meet across six hit shows, making it a fun way to see the Nickelodeon universe from a new perspective.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5
  • PS4
  • Xbox
  • Switch

Paw Patrol World

$20

This open-world adventure has you cruising around as all the iconic pups from the hit TV Show as they try to stop Mayor Humdinger’s super blimp. You’ll get the chance to complete missions based on the show as you explore Jake’s Mountain, Barkingburg, and other familiar spots. You can also customize your character and vehicles with a variety of unlockable cosmetics. Cooperative play supports up to two players.

PJ Masks Power Heroes: Mighty Alliances

$20

Rebuild PJ Power HQ as you travel through 2D levels to discover all of your headquarters' missing components. Characters have unique skills to help you on your journey (such as super speed and creating snowballs), which should keep things interesting as you fend off the bad guys and locate all your missing gear. Controls are designed to be easy and accessible for everyone, making it a great game for players of all ages.

See at Best Buy

  • PS4
  • Xbox
  • Switch

Rugrats Adventures in Gameland

$40

Dive into retro Rugrat gameplay with this cooperative platformer. You and up to one other player will work through six different levels inspired by the Pickles’ residence, playing as Tommy, Chuckie, Phil, and Lil. The game features hand-drawn animations that do a solid job of recreating the show’s unique art style, and you’ll have the option to swap between 8-bit and HD graphic styles.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5
  • Switch

The Grinch Christmas Adventures

$40

We’re a long way from Christmas, but it’s never too early for the Grinch to start crafting a plan to stop Christmas. Follow him on this 2D journey as he steals presents from Who-ville, which features colorful graphics inspired by the original Dr. Seuss book. This version also includes four holiday postcards as a bonus.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5
  • Switch

SpongeBob SquarePants: The Cosmic Shake

$24 - $30

Jump into the aquatic shoes of SpongeBob as he and Patrick set out to rescue the citizens of Bikini Bottom from the alternate realities they’re trapped inside. Aside from the usual 3D platforming hijinks and the show's trademark sense of humor, you’ll get to unlock dozens of hilarious costumes, learn a variety of skills and karate moves to help you overcome even the most challenging obstacles, and enjoy a soundtrack consisting of 101 songs from the TV show.

See at Best Buy

  • PS4 -- $24 ($30)
  • Switch -- $30

SpongeBob SquarePants: A Patrick Star Game

$26 - $30

Prefer Patrick over SpongeBob? Then A Patrick Star Game might be a better fit. You’re free to roam around Bikini Bottom and cause mayhem, making liberal use of the game’s wild physics system as you tear through the Krusty Krab, Glove World, and other famous locations at the bottom of the sea. Along with all the usual faces, you’ll have the opportunity to unlock funky new costumes for Patrick, giving your mayhem a bit of structure. A steelbook version is also up for grabs exclusively at Best Buy.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $30
  • PS4 -- $30
  • Xbox -- $30
  • Switch (Steelbook) -- $30
  • Switch -- $26 ($30)

The Smurfs: Dreams

$43 - $50

Gargamel has trapped the Smurfs in a deep slumber, and it’s up to you to free them from his evil grasp. You and up to one other player will head out on a 3D platforming adventure to overcome Gargamel’s traps and locate each missing Smurf. Each level features new and increasingly devious obstacles to avoid, and you’ll find plenty of hidden collectibles along the way.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $50
  • Switch -- $43 ($50)

The Smurfs 2: Prisoners of the Green Stone

$31 - $40

An attempt to steal the powerful Green Stone from Gargamel goes wrong, causing the Green Stone to explode into fragments that scatter throughout the land. It also unleashes a new evil force, Stolas, and it’ll be up to both the Smurfs and Gargamel to prevent Stolas from destroying Smurf Village. The cooperative 3D platformer lets you see three new regions in the Smurf universe and enjoy deeper combat thanks to the latest innovation in Smurf technology--the SmurfoMix.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $31 ($40)
  • PS4 -- $40
  • Xbox -- $40
  • Switch -- $35 ($40)

The Smurfs Village Party

$40

The Smurfs Village Party is essentially two games in one. The first mode is Adventure, which tasks you with exploring 10 regions and meeting over 100 Smurfs as you complete a variety of quests. The second mode is Party Game, which supports up to four local players and has you battling it out in 50 mini-games. These fall into six different categories (sport, luck, memory, battle, accuracy, and quickness), so only the most versatile Smurf will emerge victorious. Give it a look if you’re seeking a fun game the whole family can enjoy.

See at Best Buy

  • PS5 -- $40
  • Switch -- $33 ($40)
